agency_desc: A cooperative of school districts that provides centralized special education services to students living within the boundaries of the participating school districts.
service_description: Provides education support for students with disabilities and special needs. Services range from consultation to resource rooms to self-contained classrooms, depending on the individual needs of the student. Assessment and special education services are generally accessed through the assigned public school.
site_details: Call for information about special education services.
site_eligibility: Living in Barr-Reeve Community, Loogootee Community, North Daviess Community, or Washington Community school districts -- Age 3-22 -- With special needs, including developmental, vision, or hearing impairments

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides support services, information, and referrals to those in recovery and their loved ones.
service_description: Provides assistance to individuals who qualify for work release but unable to afford the cost. Program helps raise money for initial startup fees.
site_details: Visit website, send email, or call for information.
site_eligibility: Individuals who qualify for work release

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides support services and social activities for youth and adults who are recovering from substance use.
service_description: Provides recovery group that is designed to prevent relapse by reducing social isolation, providing positive modeling behaviors, encouraging honest feedback, and increasing emotional support.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Visit website or call for information.
site_eligibility: Individuals recovering from substance use, mental health challenges, trauma, homelessness, and systemic racism.

agency_desc: County veterans service officers are veterans employed by the county to act as liaisons with county residents for veteran issues, including but not limited to; providing forms, information, and assistance in obtaining state and federal veterans benefits.
service_description: Provides information about and assistance with veterans' benefits to veterans, their surviving spouses, and their children. County service officers can assist in the completion and submission of forms necessary to receive all appropriate federal and state veterans' benefits.
site_details: Call or email to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Veteran, surviving spouses or children of a veteran

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency providing confidential pregnancy testing, limited obstetric ultrasound, and information regarding adoption and abortion alternatives. This agency also offers parenting classes and material support. STI testing and treatment available as well.
service_description: Provides free pregnancy testing and verification to women in need. Offers limited obstetric ultrasound to diagnose pregnancy, pregnancy counseling and referrals to prenatal care, adoption resources, abortion alternatives, and other support services.
site_details: Appointments preferred, but walk-ins welcome
site_schedule: Mon and Wed 9am-noon and 1pm-6pm; Tues and Thurs 9am-noon and 1pm-4pm; Hotline: Daily 24 Hours
Mon and Wed 9am-noon and 1pm-6pm; Tues and Thurs 9am-noon and 1pm-4pm; Hotline: Daily 24 Hours

site_eligibility: Pregnant women in need of services

agency_name: MENTAL HEALTH AMERICA OF DAVIESS COUNTY
agency_desc: Offers mental health information, referrals, and educational resources for those in need.
site_name: MENTAL HEALTH AMERICA OF DAVIESS COUNTY
service_description: Offers mental health information, referrals, and educational resources. Advocates on behalf of adults and children with mental and emotional disorders and their families. Promotes increased public awareness on mental health issues and lobbies for public and private policies that protect the rights and well-being of persons with mental illness. Board meetings occur quarterly.
site_details: Use email address: dcmha47501@gmail.com -OR- find appropriate service at website address www.dcmha47501.wix.com/dcmha.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit animal shelter that contracts with the city of Washington to provide animal control services.
service_description: Enforces animal-related ordinances in the city of Washington, traps nuisance wildlife, removes dead animals from the streets and other properties, responds to animal-related emergencies, impounds stray domestic animals, provides lost-and-found services, and accepts surrendered animals from the public. Due to space limitations, not all surrendered animals can be held for adoption and may be euthanized at any time. Owners are encouraged to explore other alternatives, such as finding the pet a new home, rather than surrender their pet to this shelter.
site_details: To report an animal concern: Call the shelter during office hours; for after-hours emergencies,  call Washington city dispatch. -- To surrender an animal: Call the shelter to make arrangements. -- To view lost and found animals: Walk in during shelter hours, or visit the website to see postings.
site_schedule: Shelter: Mon, Wed, and Fri 9am-3:30pm; Tues and Thurs 9am-5pm; Sat 8am-noon -- Animal Control Dispatch: Daily 24 hours
Shelter: Mon, Wed, and Fri 9am-3:30pm; Tues and Thurs 9am-5pm; Sat 8am-noon -- Animal Control Dispatch: Daily 24 hours
Shelter: Mon, Wed, and Fri 9am-3:30pm; Tues and Thurs 9am-5pm; Sat 8am-noon -- Animal Control Dispatch: Daily 24 hours
Shelter: Mon, Wed, and Fri 9am-3:30pm; Tues and Thurs 9am-5pm; Sat 8am-noon -- Animal Control Dispatch: Daily 24 hours
Mon, Wed, and Fri 9am-3:30pm; Tues and Thurs 9am-5pm; Sat 8am-noon
site_eligibility: To report an animal concern: Open; serves the city of Washington only -- To surrender a pet: Living in Daviess County

agency_desc: A faith-based, nonprofit organization offering residential treatment, counseling, and support services for adult men and women recovering from substance abuse.
service_description: Provides supervised, residential, substance abuse treatment for women recovering from drug or alcohol addiction. Additional services include individual and group counseling, life skills education, and job search assistance.
taxonomy_name: Transitional Residential Substance Use Disorder Services
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
nameLevel3: Transitional Residential Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Walk in to pick up n application, call to request one be sent by mail, or visit website to download an application. Drop of completed application at this housing location.
site_eligibility: Women -- Age 18 or older -- Recovering from drug or alcohol addiction -- Willing to obtain employment -- Without a history of violent crimes -- Not a registered sex offender

agency_desc: A faith-based, nonprofit organization offering residential treatment, counseling, and support services for adult men and women recovering from substance abuse.
service_description: Provides supervised, residential, substance abuse treatment for women recovering from drug or alcohol addiction. Additional services include individual and group counseling, life skills education, and job search assistance.
taxonomy_name: Transitional Residential Substance Use Disorder Services
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
nameLevel3: Transitional Residential Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Walk in to pick up n application, call to request one be sent by mail, or visit website to download an application. Drop of completed application at this housing location.
site_eligibility: Women -- Age 18 or older, with children (boys up to age 12; girls up to age 17) -- Recovering from drug or alcohol addiction -- Willing to obtain employment -- Without a history of violent crimes -- Not a registered sex offender

agency_desc: A faith-based, nonprofit organization offering residential treatment, counseling, and support services for adult men and women recovering from substance abuse.
service_description: Provides supervised, residential, substance abuse treatment for men recovering from drug or alcohol addiction. Additional services include individual and group counseling, life skills education, and job search assistance.
taxonomy_name: Transitional Residential Substance Use Disorder Services
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
nameLevel3: Transitional Residential Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Walk in to pick up n application or call to request one be sent by mail, or visit website to download an application. Drop of completed application at this housing location.
site_eligibility: Men -- Age 18 or older -- Recovering from drug or alcohol addiction -- Willing to obtain employment -- Without a history of violent crimes -- Not a registered sex offender

agency_name: SAINT VINCENT DE PAUL SOCIETY OF WASHINGTON
agency_desc: A faith-based nonprofit offering charitable outreach to persons in need.
site_name: SAINT VINCENT DE PAUL SOCIETY OF WASHINGTON
service_description: Sells gently used clothing, small household goods, furniture, and appliances at discounted prices. Selection varies by donations.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit community organization that provides services to those in need. Services include early head start, head start, health clinic, Energy Assistance Program, weatherization, and small business loans.
site_name: PACE HEALTH CONNECTION CLINIC - DAVIESS COUNTY
service_description: Provides access to reproductive health services, including physical exams, birth control, pregnancy testing and verification, Pap tests, testing and treatment for sexually transmitted diseases/infections, and HIV testing. Services for both men and women.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment -OR- walk in.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: An Indiana Area Agency on Aging, providing services to seniors and persons with disabilities in Daviess, Dubois, Greene, Knox, Martin, and Pike County.
service_description: Provides nutritious, sit-down lunches and fellowship for area seniors. Diabetic menu available. Reservations required 24 hours in advance. Small donation requested.
site_details: Call the senior center at least 24 hours in advance for reservations.
site_eligibility: Persons age 60 and older or persons with disabilities and their spouses or caregivers

agency_desc: Offers a full-service hospital providing a wide range of diagnostic, treatment, and health care programs, including 24-hour emergency care.
service_description: Offers individual, group, couple, and family counseling for adults, adolescents, and children by appointment. Also offers psychiatric and psychological assessment, consultation, and treatment services.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call intake line to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Open (minimum age served determined by individual assessment)

agency_desc: Provides electric service to customers in Daviess and Martin counties and portions of Lawrence County.
service_description: Provides electric service to customers in Daviess and Martin counties and portions of Lawrence County.
site_details: Call for assistance; bill can be paid online, in person, by mail, or by phone; a drop box is available at this location.
site_schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 7:30am-4pm -- Outage Reporting: Daily 24 hours
site_eligibility: Addresses within set boundaries in Daviess, Lawrence, and Martin counties

agency_desc: Represents the state of Indiana in felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions, conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic violations, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
service_description: Investigates allegations of abuse, neglect, self-neglect, and exploitation of endangered adults (adults who are incapable of caring for themselves or managing their property due to physical or mental incapacity.) Indiana law requires persons to report all cases of suspected abuse, neglect, or exploitation of an endangered adult to the nearest Adult Protective Services office or to law enforcement agents. All reports are confidential.
site_details: Call to make a report; provide as much detail about the situation as possible. -- For emergencies or after-hours reports, please call local police or county dispatch.
site_schedule: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Indiana KidsLine (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours; live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-6pm
Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Indiana KidsLine (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours; live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-6pm
site_eligibility: Persons who suspect abuse, neglect, self-neglect, or exploitation of an endangered adult.

agency_desc: A faith-based, nonprofit food pantry.
service_description: Provides nonperishable food to people in need. Emergency food assistance is available by appointment. Limited service area.
site_details: Walk in during pantry hours. -- Be in line by 1pm on Monday or Friday to receive a box of produce.
site_schedule: Monthly 3rd Sat 9am-noon -- Monthly 4th Thurs 6pm-7pm -- Produce Box: Mon or Fri at 1pm
site_eligibility: Not used this pantry during the past 30 days; bread is available weekly

agency_desc: A faith-based, nonprofit food pantry.
service_description: Provides nonperishable food to people in need. Emergency food assistance is available by appointment. Limited service area.
site_details: Walk in during pantry hours.
site_eligibility: Not used this pantry during the past 30 days

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
taxonomy_name: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions
nameLevel4: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement services and maintains the correctional facility for Daviess County.
service_description: Provides law enforcement, crime prevention, and criminal investigation services and administers county correctional facilities in Daviess County. Operates a 24-hour dispatch service for police officers, firefighters, and medics (ambulances) in Daviess County. A seven-digit dispatch number is provided for nonemergency dispatch calls. For emergency assistance, persons should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency police, fire, or medical assistance. For nonemergency requests or reports, call the office during normal business hours. nonemergency dispatch number.
site_eligibility: Open; serves Daviess County

agency_desc: Serves as the executive and administrative authority for Daviess County.
service_description: Serves as the executive and administrative authority fortheir respectivecounty, including performing the following duties:controls, maintains, and supervises county property; audits and authorizes claims against the county; receives bids for and authorizes county contracts; performs certain election functions; handlesappealof township trustee decisions.
site_details: Call for assistance.
site_schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Board Meetings: 2nd and 4th Tues 9am
Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Board Meetings: 2nd and 4th Tues 9am
site_eligibility: Varies by service

agency_desc: A nonprofit hospital providing a wide range of diagnostic, treatment, and health care programs, including 24-hour emergency care.
service_description: Provides a peer recovery coach to assist those with an active alcohol or drug addiction, in recovery, or anyone concerned about someone else's addiction.
taxonomy_name: Substance Use Disorder Peer Recovery Coach Services
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
nameLevel4: Substance Use Disorder Peer Recovery Coach Services
site_details: Visit website to complete Peer Recovery Request Form or call to schedule an appointment; leave a voicemail with name, contact number, and information needed.
site_schedule: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm; on-call staff available after hours
site_eligibility: Individuals with an active alcohol or drug addiction, or in recovery -- Individuals concerned about someone else's addiction

agency_desc: A nonprofit hospital providing a wide range of diagnostic, treatment, and health care programs, including 24-hour emergency care.
site_name: DAVIESS COMMUNITY HOSPITAL - MEDICAL CLINIC - RURAL HEALTH
service_description: Provides a full-service health clinic that specializes in primary care. Services include minor injuries and illnesses, physical exams (including exams for school and employment), immunizations, lab work, wellness care, and treatment of acute and chronic health problems.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit hospital providing a wide range of diagnostic, treatment, and health care programs, including 24-hour emergency care.
service_description: Provides a full-service health clinic that specializes in primary care. Services include minor injuries and illnesses, physical exams (including exams for school and employment), immunizations, lab work, wellness care, and treatment of acute and chronic health problems.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Open

service_description: Provides a full-service health clinic that specializes in primary care. Services include minor injuries and illnesses, physical exams (including exams for school and employment), immunizations, lab work, wellness care, and treatment of acute and chronic health problems.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit hospital providing a wide range of diagnostic, treatment, and health care programs, including 24-hour emergency care.
site_name: DAVIESS COMMUNITY HOSPITAL - NORTH DAVIESS MEDICAL CLINIC
service_description: Provides a full-service health clinic that specializes in primary care. Services include minor injuries and illnesses, physical exams (including exams for school and employment), immunizations, lab work, wellness care, and treatment of acute and chronic health problems.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A public library that provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials to patrons of all ages.
service_description: Maintains a public lending library and provides phone-based reference assistance. In-house services include public computer and Internet access.
site_details: Walk in to apply for a library card, check out materials, or use in-house services. Call for information.
site_schedule: Tues and Thurs noon-6pm; Wed and Sat 9am-1pm; Fri noon-5pm
Tues and Thurs noon-6pm; Wed and Sat 9am-1pm; Fri noon-5pm
site_eligibility: Most in-house services, including computer stations: Open; youth under 18 must have signed permission from parent or guardian -- For a library card: Living in Madison or Van Buren Township of Daviess County

agency_desc: A public library that provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials to patrons of all ages.
service_description: Maintains a public lending library and provides phone-based reference assistance. In-house services include public computer and Internet access.
site_details: Walk in to apply for a library card, check out materials, or use in-house services. Call for information.
site_schedule: Tutoring: Vary; tutors and students coordinate to schedule sessions.
site_eligibility: Most in-house services, including computer stations: Open -- For a library card: Living in the city of Washington

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides flu shots seasonally (beginning in the fall) to people age six months and older, until supplies are gone.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment or for availability of walk-in hours.
site_eligibility: Open -- Age 6 months or older

agency_desc: A government agency that administers housing assistance programs for the city of Washington.
service_description: Provides subsidized, income-based rental units in city of Washington to eligible families, seniors, and persons with disabilities. Applications to be placed on the wait list are currently being accepted.
site_details: Walk in to fill out an application.
site_eligibility: Low-income families and individuals -OR- Elderly -OR- Disabled

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities, administers jury draw, child support collections,and voter registration; issues marriage licenses; and records state tax liens in Daviess County.
service_description: Processes court-ordered child support payments in Daviess County, and provides parents records of payment history on request. Payer and payee must keep their names and addresses current with the clerks office; any changes must be made in writing. Payment history information is also available from this office.
taxonomy_name: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
nameLevel4: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
site_details: Payment history print out: Walk in to obtain. -- Update name/address: Walk in or mail changes. -- Payment Information: Visit website or call the Indiana Kids Line.
site_schedule: Clerk's Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Indiana Kids Line (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours; live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-6pm
site_eligibility: Parents ordered by the court to pay or receive child support

agency_desc: Government agency that locates, identifies, and appraises all taxable property in Daviess County.
service_description: Calculates the value of all taxable property in Daviess County, which is then used to assess taxes. Hears appeals of assessments, oversees reassessments, and maintains information on boundaries and ownership.
site_details: Call or visit the website for more information.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; limited to taxable property in Daviess County

agency_desc: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools within the district.
service_description: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools in this school district. Provides student transportation services and maintains information on school locations, enrollment, fees, and curricula. District provides information regarding special education services for students age 3-22 with disabilities.
site_details: Call for information about school assignments, transportation, or other issues. -- Contact the assigned school to enroll.
site_eligibility: Students living within the school district in grades K-12

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the city of Washington in Daviess County.
service_description: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the city of Washington in Daviess County. Persons in need of emergency police assistance should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency assistance. For nonemergency services, call the office during business hours or call City dispatch after hours.
site_eligibility: Open; serves the city of Washington in Daviess County

agency_desc: Provides emergency fire and medical services for the city of Washington in Daviess County.
service_description: Responds to fire, emergency medical, hazardous material, and special rescue situations in the city of Washington in Daviess County. Persons in need of emergency services in Washington should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency assistance. For nonemergency services, call the office during business hours.
site_eligibility: Open; responds to emergency situations in the city of Washington

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Provides probation services for the Daviess County Circuit and Superior Courts, including supervising juvenile and adult offenders in the community and linking them with programs and services to support their rehabilitation.
site_details: Through the courts; call for information.
site_eligibility: Offenders assigned to probation by the Daviess County Courts

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services for the city of Washington in Daviess County.
service_description: Provides governance and municipal services for the city of Washington in Daviess County. Responds to questions, complaints, and requests regarding town government and services.
site_details: Call or walk in during office hours for information.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services for the city of Washington in Daviess County.
site_name: WASHINGTON BUILDING COMMISSION AND CODE ENFORCEMENT
service_description: Oversees housing and commercial development and enforces zoning ordinances for the cities of Washington and Odon in Daviess County. This department issues permits and conducts inspections for construction and remodeling projects, responds to reports of overgrown weeds on private property, and handles zoning requests, complaints, and appeals.
nameLevel3: Land Use Planning and Regulation Services
site_details: Call, walk in, or visit the website for information.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services for the city of Washington in Daviess County.
service_description: Provides electricity to the city of Washington in Daviess County through a locally owned and operated utility company partnering with the Indiana Municipal Power Agency (IMPA).
site_details: Mail payment to office, walk in during office hours, or pay online -- For new service: Call or walk in during office hours be prepared to provide Social Security or Driver's License number, phone number, and address of property where service is being requested.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services for the city of Washington in Daviess County.
service_description: Maintains and provides information about public park facilities and programming in the city of Washington in Washington County. Programs vary by season, but may include team sports, summer youth clubs, and after-school programs.
site_details: Walk in to visit the parks; call or visit the website for information.
site_schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4:30pm -- Parks: Daily dawn to dusk, unless otherwise noted
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services for the city of Washington in Daviess County.
service_description: Provides street and sidewalk maintenance, snow and ice control, street-sign maintenance, mosquito control, and trash and recycling pickup in the city of Washington in Daviess County.
site_details: Call or walk in for information, to submit a request, or make a report.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Provides maintenance services on public roads and streets.
service_description: Maintains county roadways in Daviess County, including patching, paving, snow removal, street sweeping, roadside mowing, and drainage along roadways.
site_details: Call for information or to report a problem. To report urgent problems after hours, call 9-1-1 or Daviess County dispatch.
site_eligibility: Open (limited to county roads and county properties in Daviess County)

agency_desc: A central resource clearinghouse and informational call center connecting families in Daviess County Indiana to resources to meet their needs.
service_description: Refers residents of Daviess County to resources that provide financial assistance for essential needs, prescription expenses, dental and vision care, and gasoline to persons in need.
site_details: Call for more information.
site_eligibility: Living in Daviess county

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that partners with local human service organizations, businesses, and government agencies to support and strengthen the community.
service_description: Helps match individuals and groups interested in volunteering with local human service agencies.
site_details: Call for information.
site_eligibility: Open to individuals and groups; specific volunteer options may have restrictions.

agency_name: DAVIESS COUNTY SOLID WASTE MANAGEMENT DISTRICT
agency_desc: A municipal agency that reduces the amount of waste going to landfills and incinerators through education, source reduction, reuse and recycling.
site_name: DAVIESS COUNTY SOLID WASTE MANAGEMENT DISTRICT
service_description: Provides a drop-off site for newspaper, cardboard, aluminum/steel cans, tires, and plastics (1-2). Information about additional Daviess County recycling sites and proper waste disposal is available during office hours.
site_details: Walk in to drop off approved recyclables; call for information.
site_eligibility: Persons living in Daviess County
